item.title: UX A Day
item.description: UX A Day looks like a nice new blog of resources and tools for UX design folks, curated by Philippe Said. Not a lot of review or commentary, but hopefully will keep us updated with new finds. http://www.uxaday.com/

item.title: fueledbycoffee iPad Sketch Blog
item.description: I've been telling people how much I dig Adobe's free Ideas app and Autodesk Sketchbook Pro for sketching on the iPad. Craighton Berman's Fueled by Coffee sketchblog will give you an idea of what sketches can look like using these tools. Ideas is super simple and smoothens your lines so things look naturally drawn. I'm really loving it. The adjustment is taking time, and it's not as quick as pen and paper, but it's slightly more natural using a Pogo Sketch Stylus.

item.title: 52 Weeks of UX
item.description: It's nice to have something good to look forward to every week, and Joshua Porter and Joshua Brewer will deliver by writing a weekly blog about user experience. Nice. http://52weeksofux.com/

item.title: Sketchnote Army
item.description: Just discovered Mike Rohde's Sketchnote Army. Sketchnote Army is dedicated to finding and showcasing sketchnotes and sketchnoters from around the world, from events, conferences, workshops or wherever sketchnotes are captured or created. If you sketchnote, send your sketchnotes URL to Mike Rohde to have them featured there. Via @katerutter http://sketchnotearmy.com/

item.title: Markup & Style Society
item.description: Distressed paper nailed to a 2x4's make up the background of this event site's blog. http://markupandstyle.org/

item.title: We are Colorblind
item.description: Wearecolorblind.com is a website about colorblindness created by Tom van Beveren. Van Beveren discusses good and bad examples of interfaces, charts and diagrams with respect to how they are viewed by color-blind users. He also provides patterns and suggestions for improving their accessibility. Would be excellent to pass some of the examples through some of the simulators I recommend. http://wearecolorblind.com/

item.title: User Experience Publications
item.description: Nick Finck has created an excellent bibliography of UX web publications. The list is grouped into three main sections; Industry Publications (non-corporate ezines and/or printed magazines), Team & Company Publications (multi-author and/or business focused publications), and Personal Publications (practitioners who write). View the list here. http://www.nickfinck.com/blog/entry/user_experience_publications/

item.title: iPhone UX Reviews
item.description: iPhone UX Reviews is a blog devoted to user experience reviews of iPhone apps & advice on creating apps. http://www.iphoneuxreviews.com/

item.title: Nick Finck
item.description: Redesign of Nick Finck.com, the personal site of Blue Flavor UX/IA partner, speaker, and Digital Web publisher. Designed by Matt Brown. Friendly, big type and a simplified navigation make it a keeper. http://www.nickfinck.com/

item.title: stopdesign is back!
item.description: Doug Bowman has started blogging again! http://stopdesign.com/

item.title: The Printed Blog
item.description: The Printed Blog is an interesting project that aims at publishing a newspaper of weblogs and user generated content. I like the idea of using this as a PDF rather than as a printed newspaper, since I no longer read printed newspapers. I also like the newspaper format, and have been using Tabbloid to peruse my must read daily feeds rather than using my RSS reader lately. I wonder, however, about taking online media and making analog versions of it.

item.title: Johnny Holland Magazine
item.description: Johnny Holland Magazine is an interesting new collaborative magazine co-authored by a handful of creatives who talk about experience design. Johnny is an open collective talking, sharing and finding answers about the interaction between people and products, systems or processes. http://johnnyholland.org/

item.title: The Grid System
item.description: The ultimate resource on Grid Systems. You'll find links to articles, books, tools, and other resources related to grid systems here. Via Coudal. http://www.thegridsystem.org/

item.title: Motionographer
item.description: Motionographer is a source of inspiration for filmmakers, animators and designers. http://motionographer.com/
